ranked_diseases.disease_name: Autoinflammatory disease, multisystem, with immune dysregulation, X-linked
ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with similar phenotypes (autoimmune hemolytic anemia and chronic diarrhea) were diagnosed with this condition. The patient's age and gender (male) are consistent with X-linked inheritance pattern.
Classic triad includes chronic diarrhea/enteropathy and autoimmune manifestations including hemolytic anemia. X-linked disorder affecting young males, consistent with patient demographics.
Can present with chronic diarrhea and autoimmune cytopenias including hemolytic anemia. However, typically presents later in life and lacks the full spectrum seen in reference cases.
Features autoimmune hemolytic anemia as a cardinal manifestation and can have gastrointestinal involvement, though chronic diarrhea is less typical than in IPEX or X-linked autoinflammatory disease.

X-linked disorder that can present with inflammatory bowel disease-like symptoms and cytopenias. The specific combination of chronic diarrhea and autoimmune hemolytic anemia is possible but less characteristic.
